definition: hard to avoid/difficult to escape from/will inevitably
to excuse sb/to exempt/to remove or dismiss from office/to avoid/to avert/to escape/to be prohibited

sentences.english: Since heartbreaking is inevitable, why should I be head over heels in love?
sentences.chinese: 明知道伤心总是难免，为何我还要一往情深。

sentences.english: In my work has to avoid some service not attentive place.
sentences.chinese: 在我的工作当中难免有一些服务不周到的地方。

sentences.english: The lone ITep is in danger of the wolf.
sentences.chinese: 孤独的羊难免遭狼的危险。

sentences.english: Comparisons in the looks department may be inevitable, though.
sentences.chinese: 不过外观上的比较是在所难免的。

sentences.english: Inevitably her exploits were exaggerated and she became known as an adventuress .
sentences.chinese: 难免会夸大她的勇敢行为，她成了有名的探险者。

sentences.english: The software design is the flaw in the plan.
sentences.chinese: 软件设计难免百密一疏。

sentences.english: There will always be innocent casualites of war, but this was not the case.
sentences.chinese: 战争中的无辜伤亡在所难免，但是，这次情况不同。

sentences.english: Pursuit of specialness is always at the cost of peace.
sentences.chinese: 追求特殊性，难免要付出平安的代价。

sentences.english: If travel is unavoidable, the Shenzhen bus network on your side.
sentences.chinese: 如果出行在所难免，深圳巴士网在您身边。

sentences.english: The best of friendships exist between people with flaws and shortcomings.
sentences.chinese: 最美好的友谊存在于那些难免有缺点错误的人们之间。

sentences.english: Wei Wei did that by herself when she was young. Language is always useful.
sentences.chinese: 难免，韦唯每次演出他总是形影不离的处理很多工作。

sentences.english: It is the inevitable consequence of the imbalance, and inequity, in the way public resources are distributed.
sentences.chinese: 失衡和公共资源的不公平分配是在所难免的。

sentences.english: Even when bickers swerve to avoid doors, they can end up getting hit by cars.
sentences.chinese: 即使骑车人赶紧转弯想避开，也难免被撞到。

sentences.english: Some tension, and got bit wrong.
sentences.chinese: 难免紧张出错，多多包涵与指教。

sentences.english: But I tell you that anyone who is angry with his brother [2] will be subject to judgment.
sentences.chinese: 只是我告诉你们，凡向弟兄动怒的，难免受审判。

sentences.english: No one is exempt from talking nonsense; the mistake is to do it solemnly .
sentences.chinese: 谁也难免会讲些废话，错就错在一本正经地讲。

definition: unlikely to go so far as to/not as bad as
after all/all in all/when all is said and done/in the final analysis
